memberdef.definition: typedef double(* biteopt_func) (int N, const double *x, void *func_data)
memberdef.name: biteopt_func

memberdef.argsstring: (const int N, biteopt_func f, void *data, const double *lb, const double *ub, double *x, double *minf, const int iter, const int M=1, const int attc=10, const int stopc=0, biteopt_rng rf=0, void *rdata=0, double *f_minp=0)
memberdef.name: biteopt_minimize

detaileddescription.para: Function performs minimization using the CBiteOpt or CBiteOptDeep algorithm.

parameterdescription.para: The number of parameters in an objective function.
Lower bounds of obj function parameters, should not be infinite.
Upper bounds of obj function parameters, should not be infinite.
The number of iterations to perform in a single attempt. Corresponds to the number of obj function evaluations that are performed.
Depth to use, 1 for plain CBiteOpt algorithm, >1 for CBiteOptDeep algorithm. Expected range is [1; 36]. Internally multiplies "iter" by sqrt(M).
The number of optimization attempts to perform.
Random number generator function; 0: use the default BiteOpt PRNG. Note that the external RNG should be seeded externally.
Data pointer to pass to the "rf" function.
If non-zero, a pointer to the stopping value: optimization will stop when this objective value is reached.

simplesect.para: The total number of function evaluations performed; useful if the "stopc" and/or "*f_minp" were used.

briefdescription.para: The inclusion file for the CBiteOpt and CBiteOptDeep classes.
